summary:
=== Purchase Information === Review Date: 2018/11/01 Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'smoking', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['David Leitch'], 'Producers': ['Simon Kinberg', 'Ryan Reynolds', 'Lauren Shuler Donner'], 'Starring': ['Ryan Reynolds', 'Josh Brolin', 'Morena Baccarin'], 'Studio': ['20th Century Fox']} Review Text: I enjoyed the first Dead Pool movie. So, had to see the sequel. It's just as good as the first. But, there was so much vulgarity in it, I felt a little let down that they had to go that far with it, to push the 'anti-hero' theme. Review Title: A great sequel to the original Dead Pool. But, much more vulgarity. Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2018/11/01 Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'Français (Canada)', 'Español (España)', 'Italiano', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Polski', '日本語', 'Português', 'Deutsch', 'Français (France)'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'Deutsch [UT]', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Español (Latinoamérica) [CC]', 'Español (España) [CC]', 'Français [CC]', 'Italiano [CC]', 'Nederlands [CC]', 'Polski', 'Português', 'Português [SDH]', 'Svenska'], 'Directors': ['Steven Spielberg'], 'Producers': ['Adam Somner', 'Daniel Lupi', 'Chris Defaria', 'Bruce Berman', 'Donald De Line', 'Kristie Macosko Krieger', 'Steven Spielberg', 'Dan Farah'], 'Starring': ['Tye Sheridan', 'Olivia Cooke', 'Ben Mendelsohn'], 'Studio': ['WARNER BROS.']} Review Text: I like the concept, how they integrated characters from so many of the classic video games. That is what really made the movie. Also, the movie itself was like a video game. That's fun for all you gamers. But, like they sometimes do, in Hollywood, they put all the best scenes in the trailer. So, there weren't any real great scenes left to impress you, as you watched the movie. Review Title: The best scenes were in the trailers, but it's still a good movie. Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2018/11/06 Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Anthony Russo', 'Joe Russo'], 'Producers': ['Kevin Feige'], 'Starring': ['Robert Downey Jr.', 'Chris Hemsworth', 'Mark Ruffalo'], 'Studio': ['Marvel']} Review Text: If you're an Avengers fan, and haven't seen this movie yet, it's a must see. I was a little lost, at first. Because I missed one or two of the movies leading up to this one. (How the hell did Thor lose his eye?) The cliffhanger at the end was both shocking and awesome. The directors did a good job. I'm fairly salivating for the next installment of the Avengers franchise! Review Title: The best Avengers movie yet! Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2019/03/06 Average Rating: 4.6 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Tyler Perry'], 'Producers': ['Mark E. Swinton', 'Will Areu', 'Tyler Perry'], 'Starring': ['Tiffany Haddish', 'Tika Sumpter', 'Omari Hardwick'], 'Studio': ['Paramount Pictures']} Review Text: I like the Madea character. I like the Madea movies. Of all the Tyler Perry movies, the comedies are the best. His dramas all fall flat on their face. His scripts are too predictable, characters too flat, story lines are like ruts on a muddy road. They follow a path, unwavering, till they get stuck... and.... die. Tiffany Haddish is great in this role. As are the other actors. They all make the movie tolerable. Some movies are larger than the actors in them. These actors are MUCH better than the movie they're in. Review Title: It's still a Tyler Perry movie. Rating: 3.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Rear Window Review Date: 2020/01/15 Categories: Suspense, Atmospheric, Compelling, Harrowing Product Description: ['A bored, injured photojournalist confined to his apartment has no choice but to busy himself with observing his neighbors. His voyeurism becomes detective work, however, when he witnesses a murder. Directed by Alfred Hitchcock.'] Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Alfred Hitchcock'], 'Producers': ['Alfred Hitchcock'], 'Starring': ['James Stewart', 'Grace Kelly', 'Wendell Corey']} Review Text: First, I didn't actually rent this video. Somehow, someone hacked my Prime account and rented it. I'm sure it was just a test, to see if they could. I have since changed my password. However, I CAN tell you that, if you haven't seen this movie before, it's one worth watching. It's one of Alfred Hitchcock's best films. And, Jimmy Stewart was perfect in the leading role. I've seen it a few times over the years and really enjoyed it. In fact, there was a remake about ten years ago. But, the first is still the best. Review Title: Jimmy Stewart and Alfred Hitchcock! Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2020/12/09 Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Roland Emmerich'], 'Producers': ['Bradley Fischer', 'Harald Kloser', 'James Vanderbilt', 'Larry Franco', 'Laeta Kalogridis', 'Roland Emmerich'], 'Starring': ['Channing Tatum', 'Jamie Foxx', 'Maggie Gyllenhaal'], 'Studio': ['Columbia Pictures']} Review Text: It's a fun movie. Almost like a take off of Olympus has fallen. But, with enough comedic quality to make it just campy enough to enjoy, without going overboard like 'Airplane'. All of the acting was well done. The special effects were great. The movie kind of reminded me of Independence Day. But, a little funnier in parts. Worth watching. Review Title: Kind of like Olympus has fallen. But campy like Independence Day. Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2021/03/08 Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Gregory Hoblit'], 'Producers': ['Charles Roven', 'Dawn Steel'], 'Starring': ['Denzel Washington', 'John Goodman', 'Donald Sutherland'], 'Studio': ['WARNER BROS.']} Review Text: Honestly, my wife and I don't even remember watching it. So, it must not have been THAT great, or that bad. Either way, I'm sure we would have some kind of recollection of that movie. So, in all fairness, I have to go down the middle of the road here and give it three stars. Review Title: Not memorable. Rating: 3.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2021/05/09 Average Rating: 4.4 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'Español'], 'Directors': ['Derrick Borte'], 'Producers': ['Mark Gill', 'Andrew Gunn'], 'Starring': ['Russell Crowe', 'Caren Pistorius', 'Gabriel Bateman'], 'Studio': ['Solstice Studios']} Review Text: First, Russel Crow has gotten REALLY FAT! And, I don't think he did it just for this movie. I think that his weight gain may be the reason why he was selected for this role, though.

This movie really will keep you on the edge of your seat. Some scenes are pretty shocking. And the ending was a total surprise, and a little cheesy. But, still good.

It was well worth the ticket. Five stars. Review Title: On the edge of your seat, for the whole movie! Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2022/01/03 Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Andy Serkis'], 'Producers': ['Avi Arad', 'Matt Tolmach', 'Amy Pascal'], 'Starring': ['Tom Hardy', 'Woody Harrelson', 'Michelle Williams'], 'Studio': ['SONY PICTURES ENTERTAINMENT', 'INC.']} Review Text: Sequels rarely measure up to the firsts. This one does. It's just as much fun, just as crazy. Woody Harrelson is very believable as the bad guy. Good movie for a 'staying home tonight' watch. Review Title: Let there be FUN! Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2022/06/11 Average Rating: 4.0 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Matt Reeves'], 'Producers': ['Michael E. Uslan', 'Walter Hamada', 'Chantal Nong Vo', 'Simon Emanuel', 'Dylan Clark', 'Matt Reeves'], 'Starring': ['Robert Pattinson', 'Zoë Kravitz', 'Jeffrey Wright'], 'Studio': ['MGM']} Review Text: I have seen every Batman pic ever produced. This one is by far the most deeply engaging one I have ever seen. It's a very dark portrayal of the Dark Night. It's also very 'realistic' in the sense that Batman doesn't have a thousand super futuristic gadgets, monstrous car, motorcycle and plane at his disposal. Bruce Wayne has some serious issues. The villains aren't ultra-rich megalomaniacs. Just common thugs. Catwoman is a pretty regular girl. But, the things that make Batman who he is still stand out. He's a detective. He doesn't use guns. He operates covertly. He has one ally in Gotham PD, Mr. Gordon, who becomes the Commissioner during the movie. The Penguin is there. As is the Riddler.

The entire movie is dark, oppressive and sinister. But, Batman is very human and a great Samaritan. I love this movie and am going to watch it again, and again and again. Review Title: The most engaging Batman movie, EVER! Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2022/07/17 Average Rating: 4.4 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium', 'Español'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'Español'], 'Directors': ['Martin Campbell'], 'Producers': ['Cathy Schulman', 'Moshe Diamant', 'Rupert Maconick', 'Michael Heimler', 'Arthur Sarkissian'], 'Starring': ['Liam Neeson', 'Guy Pearce', 'Monica Bellucci']} Review Text: Liam is an outstanding character actor. He may not be a superstar like John Wayne. But, he definitely delivers in every one of his films. He knows his genre and sticks with it. Memory is one of his better films. Review Title: Liam Neeson does his thing! Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2022/08/28 Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Pierre Coffin', 'Kyle Balda'], 'Producers': ['Christopher Meledandri', 'Janet Healy'], 'Starring': ['Steve Carell', 'Kristen Wiig', 'Trey Parker'], 'Studio': ['Universal Pictures']} Review Text: The best thing about all of the Despicable Me movies is all the visual comedy, schtick. You can watch the same movie several times and still not get all of the little gems of rib ticklers. All of the other movies in this series followed the plot line, having a good climactic encounter with the good and bad guys and a happy conclusion.

None of the key elements of a great movie are in this one. The story line gets fuzzy about halfway through. The plot weakens. The ending is actually anti-climatic.

All of the humor is there. Even enough double entendre for us grownups. Plenty of visual gags. However, this is the first of the series that in my opinion 'bombed' and will not watch it again. It was that dissappointing. Review Title: Just missed the mark and had some big holes in it. Rating: 3.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2022/11/19 Average Rating: 4.2 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Brent Christy'], 'Producers': ['Jason White', 'Elizabeth Buraglio', 'Gary Wheeler'], 'Starring': ['Tom Wopat', 'Kelsey Crane', 'Denim Richards'], 'Studio': ['Imagicomm Entertainment']} Review Text: Lots of action and drama. Very well written, directed and the actors are great. Review Title: Good movie Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2022/11/19 Average Rating: 4.0 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['John Pogue'], 'Producers': ['Hunt Lowry', 'Patty Reed'], 'Starring': ['Dominic Sherwood', 'Jacky Lai'], 'Studio': ['WARNER BROS.']} Review Text: For me, the sequels are rarely as good as the original. This one is no different. The plot and story line are somewhat lacking. The directing and acting aren't as good either. Review Title: Not the greatest sequel I've seen. Rating: 3.0 --------------------------------------------------

raw_response:
POSITIVE SUMMARY:
The user has found enjoyment in a variety of films, noting strong performances by actors and engaging storylines. They appreciate well-executed concepts, especially when integrating game elements or humor. Many reviews mention that films provided fun experiences, with positive remarks on special effects and directing. Notably, the user loves sequels that match the excitement of their predecessors, emphasizing their interest in thrilling narratives and character-driven plots. Overall, the enjoyment derived from visual comedy and action-driven drama stands out as a key aspect of their viewing preferences.

NEGATIVE SUMMARY:
The user has expressed disappointment with several films, highlighting excessive vulgarity, poorly executed plots, and lackluster sequels. They particularly mention that some movies failed to deliver memorable moments or engaging storylines, often stating that trailers contained all the best scenes. Specific critiques include predictability in scripts and flat character development. Some films seemed to miss the mark in balancing humor and storyline, leading the user to perceive them as disappointing or unworthy of rewatching.

OVERALL SUMMARY:
The user demonstrates a diverse taste in film, enjoying a mix of action, comedy, and drama. They appreciate strong performances and creative concepts but are critical of extreme vulgarity and unoriginal sequels. While they find pleasures in several engaging titles, they also encounter letdowns, especially when expectation does not meet reality, such as in predictable narratives. This balance of positive and negative experiences reflects their discerning nature as a viewer and desire for quality storytelling in their film selections.

target_interaction.title: Mostly 'ho-hum'.
target_interaction.text: I was hoping for better. This is the kind of movie that, after about 30 minutes, you already know how it's going to end. And, you're wishing that it would end sooner. But, you watch the rest of it anyway. Mostly because, you feel like you need to see it through.
